Posts.Content: Apr 3, 2014 08:45PM banjokatt wrote: debsing: I don't know if it's appropriate to post here but there is a website called Colon Club that has a discussion board (forum). The people who post there routinely have blockages and seem to know a lot about them. I know that bc mets are different from cc mets but the blockages they experience seem very similar to what you are going through.  I'm sure they could answer any questions you may have. They are very friendly and don't seem to mind questions. Many are Stage IV themselves. They probably can give you the name of some colon specialists in your area as well. Once again, I hope you don't mind my intrusion but I'm hoping this information may help you in some way, Good luck and God bless, Banjokatt
Posts.Title: bowel obstruction debsing Bestbird

Posts.Content: Mar 17, 2015 03:07PM banjokatt wrote: Sorry to jump in here, but you can't just stop an anti-anxiety med like Xanax. You have to taper off of it very gradually. It can take as long as a week or more. Your doc should be able to help you with the taper. I once stopped taking Xanax without the taper and thought I was going to die -- had the shakes, lightheadedness, vomiting, just about ever se possible. If you can't get hold of your doc, take one half the dose and it should help. Once again, sorry for intruding, but I know how hellish it is to stop cold turkey! Banjokatt (caregiver}
Posts.Title: Feel like I am really loosing control patti4511 stagefree

Posts.Content: Dec 19, 2015 01:29AM banjokatt wrote: Don't know if this is the right place to post but there have been some questions/comments lately about HIPEC and bowel blockages. There are a lot of discussions about these procedures at colonclub.com (discussion forum). Maybe you can get some information here. Good luck and God bless. Banjokatt
